intro: Tetraena clavata, commonly known as the clustered tetraena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its branched, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces capsule fruits containing seeds. Tetraena clavata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
